page.title: 04All Saints Church,Newborough
page.content: This{Anglican}church was dedicated in {1901}to{All Saints}and designed by {Oldrid Scott.}It was built on the site of a pub using stone from Hollington, Pateley Bridge and Harrogate. The tower is{120ft}high with{5 bells}and stained glass in the church depicts the various saints. { Interior}- Contains a 3 manual organ, 36 oak pews, pulpit designed by{Scott & made by{Ryders,}the font from old Newborough church and choirstalls from Rangemore church. The screen is a memorial to the{Clay}family and the lectern a carved eagle. { Churchyard}- Little space remains for burial plots and it is planted with yews, limes & beeches. { Vicar}- Shared by Needwood Group and lives in an adjoining village. { Services}- 1 every Sunday. { Congregation}- Average attendance 20.
